title: A2141 5V 250 milliamps
message:
A2141 came in taking 5v, 200-250 milliamps...
I've taken some measurements and found PP3V3G3H_RTC reading a little lower than expected in diode mode.. I looked in the the thermal camera and found U6960 (PP3V3G3H_RTC VR) to be heating up.. I replaced it.
Board still taking 5v 200-250 milliamps.. I've taken another look into the thermal camera and found a USB-C controller (CD3217) one of them is heating up.. I replaced it..
Still 5v 200-250 milliamps.. taken another look at the thermal cam and now it's T2 heating up
I've put the board into its housing and put the computer in DFU and entered successfully, tried reviving the computer and its not showing any signs of life whatsoever.. giving me error "4042"
Is there anything else I can look into it?
Can it be a problem with the U7800 Calpe PMU? Can it be an issue with the T2 itself? I'm more than happy to troubleshoot it but never given the shot to dive deep.. I'm not sure on which rails should be present too.

edit: one hint *might* help is that the trackpad does not click, usually when those computer in a certain state the trackpad clicks but does not show life.. this one does not show signs of life or clicking trackpad.

title: A2141 5V 250 milliamps
message:
The SLPS2R and AWAKE volatges are stable?
Check on the small coils around U7800.

Also compare diode mode readings on the big coils with good board.
If not available, use reference table:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/820-01700[/URL]
Don't forget L9080/580.

PP1V8_SLPS2R [B]1.8v[/B]
PP1V1_SLPS2R [B]1.1v[/B]

PP0V82_SLPDDR [B]0.823v[/B]

PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 [B]no voltage

PPVCCPRIMCORE_PRIM_REG [B]0.178[/B] (OBD: 109)

PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 L9080: [B]0.435[/B]
PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 L9580: [B]0.406[/B]

title: A2141 5V 250 milliamps
message:
Any G3S voltage present?

Did you test with original 96/140W charger?

Many times revive doesn't help.
I saw several cases when restore fixed problems, instead of revive.
Be aware, restore erase SSD; confirm this with the client first.

title: A2141 5V 250 milliamps
message:
PP5V_G3S not present 
PP3V3_G3S not present 
PP1V8_G3S not present 

I'm sorry, what does that mean? "G3S" status not being present? 

And yes I use 96W genuine. 

I will see the customer if he's OK with erase.
